objects.name: Test that I mute one video stream only affects the media recorder using that stream, not all media recordings active

steps.expected: Then a permission prompt should appear
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozqa.com/qa-testcase-data/webapi/mediarecorder/index.html, select camera, and hit setup

steps.expected: Then a set of media recorder controls should appear
steps.instruction: When I grant permissions

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that recording has started
steps.instruction: When I select to mute the media stream & start recording at http://mozqa.com/qa-testcase-data/webapi/mediarecorder/index.html

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that recording has started
steps.instruction: When I select to start recording in the hosted app from http://mozqa.com/qa-testcase-data/webapi/mediarecorder/index.html

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that each recording has become inactive
steps.instruction: When after recording for five seconds, I decide to stop each recording active

steps.expected: Then I should see black screen for five seconds
steps.instruction: When I select the blob URL generated from the website

steps.expected: Then I should see video I recorded for five seconds
steps.instruction: When I select the blob URL generated from the hosted app

objects.name: Test that releasing one stream active in a VIDEO recording does not release other active streams in a media recording across different processes

steps.expected: Then a permission prompt should appear
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozqa.com/qa-testcase-data/webapi/mediarecorder/index.html, select camera, and hit setup

steps.expected: Then a set of media recorder controls should appear
steps.instruction: When I grant permissions

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that recording has started for each recording
steps.instruction: When I select to start recording in the website & hosted app

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that recording has become inactive
steps.instruction: When I select to stop the media stream in the website

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that recording has become inactive
steps.instruction: When after five seconds of video capture, I stop the recording in the hosted app

steps.expected: Then I should not see the five seconds of video generation that was recorded
steps.instruction: When I go to the blob URL in the website

steps.expected: Then I should see the five seconds of video generated that was recorded
steps.instruction: When I go to the blob URL in the hosted app

- 2 devices, able to send MMS from one to the other.

- View report
- Delete message

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
- DSDS device
- 2 devices able to send/receive message
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify user can select sim to send message in app

steps.instruction: Launch message app in sender

steps.expected: New message draft is created as expected
steps.instruction: Create a new message

steps.expected: A prompt with two sim option is shown
steps.instruction: After typing recipient and message content, long tap on send

steps.expected:
Message is sent successfully;
On receiver's device, check if the message is from sim 1
steps.instruction: Select sim 1 and then send the message

steps.expected: Prompt window shown
steps.instruction: In same message thread, long tap on send

steps.expected: Verify from receiver if sender is sim2 as expected
steps.instruction: Select sim 2 and then send the message

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
- A dual sim device
- Two available sim cards
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify default sim can be changed

steps.expected: Both sim card can be recognized.
steps.instruction: Launch settings app, tap "sim manager"

steps.expected: A prompt shown with "sim1", "sim2", "always ask"
steps.instruction: Tap selector below "outgoing messages"
Choose sim2

steps.expected: Message app started successfully
steps.instruction: Return to home and launch message app

steps.expected: Default sim become sim2 at the top of send button
steps.instruction: Create a new message

steps.expected: Message sent and received successfully
steps.instruction: Send a message to sender's sim1

steps.expected: Sim2 is shown as sender with time stamp info.
steps.instruction: Long press on received message, choose detail information

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
- A dual sim device
-available sim card in slot2, no sim in slot1
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify default sim when one sim inserted

steps.expected: sim2 can be recognized.

steps.expected: It shows sim2 and can't be modified
steps.instruction: Tap selector below "outgoing messages"

steps.expected: Message app started successfully
steps.instruction: Return to home and launch message app

steps.expected: SIM number is not shown around the send button, but is in the status bar next to the signal icon.
steps.instruction: Create a new message

steps.expected: Message is received successfully
steps.instruction: Send message

steps.expected:
Message Report:
Text Message (SMS)
Sent date&time
Received date&time
From
steps.instruction: Long press on received message, choose detail information

steps.expected:

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
- A dual sim device
-2 available sim cards
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify default sim when setting always ask

objects.description:
As a user, I can disable SIM PIN on both SIM cards even they are locked.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Disable SIM PIN before unlock it

steps.expected: Both SIM 1 and SIM 2 are listed for user to configure.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM Manager > SIM security
Enable  PIN lock on both cards

steps.expected: Enter PIN code pages will show.
steps.instruction: Reboot device.

steps.expected: SIM 2 PIN code entry page will show.
steps.instruction: Skip SIM 1 PIN code entry page.
Skip SIM 2 PIN code entry page.

steps.expected: Both SIM cards PIN are enabled.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM Manager > SIM security.

steps.expected: SIM 1 PIN is disabled in SIM security and SIM 1 will camp on network.
steps.instruction: Disable SIM 1 PIN by entering correct PIN code after tap toggle switch.

steps.expected: SIM 2 PIN is disabled in SIM security and SIM 1 will camp on network.
steps.instruction: Disable SIM 2 PIN by entering correct PIN code after tap toggle switch.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can change SIM PIN when there is only one card in device.

Prerequisite:  Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
objects.name: [DSDS] Change PIN code (One SIM inserted)

steps.instruction: Insert one SIM in SIM 1 slot, power on device.

steps.expected: Change PIN option is available.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM Manager > SIM security, enable SIM 1 PIN.

steps.expected: SIM 1 PIN code can be changed and related successful message will show.
steps.instruction: Change SIM PIN code.
Power off device. Remove current SIM and insert another SIM into SIM 2 slot, power device on.

steps.expected: Change PIN option is available.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM Manager > SIM security, enable SIM 2 PIN.

steps.expected: SIM 2 PIN code can be changed and related successful message will show.
steps.instruction: Change SIM PIN code.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, once I enter incorrect PIN code while changing PIN, device will indicate correct remaining retry numbers.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Enter incorrect PIN code while changing SIM PIN

steps.expected: Change PIN option is available.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM Manager > SIM security, enable both SIM PIN.

steps.expected: Page for user to enter current and new PIN codes will be shown.
steps.instruction: Tap Change SIM item below SIM 1 PIN.

steps.expected: It will show 2 tries left.
steps.instruction: Enter incorrect SIM PIN and identical new code for "Create PIN" and "Confirm new PIN"

steps.expected: Page for user to enter current and new PIN codes will be shown, and no retry message on it.
steps.instruction: Back to SIM security, tap Change SIM item below SIM 2 PIN.

steps.expected: Page will show last retry left.
steps.instruction: Enter incorrect SIM PIN and identical new code for "Create PIN" and "Confirm new PIN" twice.

steps.expected: It will still show 2 tries left.
steps.instruction: Back to SIM security, tap Change SIM item below SIM 1 PIN.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

Prerequisite:
0 SIMs needed, a device with 2 SIM slots.

As a user I want to see no STK icon when there are 0 SIMs in the device.

steps.expected: No "Operator Services", no STK icon appear.
steps.instruction: Launch "Settings" app, scroll to the bottom.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
2 SIM needed, a device with 2 SIM slots.

As a user, I am able to receive STK events from each SIM (once SIM card/s is/are available), In case of STK events coming from both SIMs simultaneously, they will be managed following a FIFO (First In First Out) approach, I am able to specifically differentiate between SIMs when accessing to STK menu from settings or receiving STK events.
objects.name: [STK][DSDS] Test of STK UI on dual sim device with 2 sim cards inserted, lock screen ON

steps.expected: Screen Lock enaabled.
steps.instruction: Launch "Settings" app, go to "Screen Lock", enable screen lock.

steps.expected: 2 STK icons listed here.
steps.instruction: Launch "Settings" app, scroll to the bottom.

steps.expected: STK command sent.
steps.instruction: Tap STK of SIM 2, try to tap on any item that will reply something back later.

steps.expected: STK command sent.
steps.instruction: Tap STK of SIM 1, try to tap on any item that will reply something back later.

steps.expected: Screen is locked.
steps.instruction: Tap power to lock screen.

steps.expected: Verified that the message has specified 'Operator Message from SIM 1'(or SIM 2 STK), and the content matches your command,
steps.instruction: Wait until STK message received.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can enable FDN of each SIM.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Enable FDN in Call settings

steps.expected: A SIM picker pops up.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings App > Call settings.

steps.expected: Call setting of SIM 1 will be opened.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 1.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 1 PIN 2 and press done.
Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 2.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 2 PIN 2 and press done.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 2 PIN 2 and press done.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to off.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Disable".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 2 PIN 2 and press done.

objects.description:
As a user, I can not make any call when FDN list is empty.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Dial a call while FDN list is empty

steps.expected: A SIM picker pops up.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings App > Call settings.

steps.expected: Call setting of SIM 1 will be opened.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 1.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 1 PIN 2 and press done.

steps.expected: FDN active message shows to inform user that the number is blocked and unable to dial it out.
steps.instruction: Do no add any authorized numbers. Go to dialer and dial out a phone number from SIM 1(Long press dial key to select it if SIM 1 is not primary outgoing call SIM).
Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 2.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 2 PIN 2 and press done.

steps.expected: FDN active message shows to inform user that the number is blocked and unable to dial it out.
steps.instruction: Do no add any authorized numbers. Go to dialer and dial out a phone number from SIM 2(Long press dial key to select it if SIM 2 is not primary outgoing call SIM).

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can add authorized number to each SIM.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Add contacts to FDN Authorized number list

steps.expected: Call settings of SIM 1 is opened.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings App > Call settings, select SIM 1.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 1 PIN 2 and press done.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 code again and contacts can be added.
steps.instruction: Open Authorized numbers item and add at least 3 contacts in it.

steps.expected: Call can be dialed out.
steps.instruction: Go to dialer, dial out a phone number that is in authorized number list added in step 4 from SIM 1(Long press dial key to select it if SIM 1 is not primary outgoing call SIM).
Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 2.

steps.expected: SIM PIN 2 request page shows.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enter SIM 2 PIN 2 and press done.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 code again and contacts can be added.
steps.instruction: Open Authorized numbers item and add at least 3 contacts in it.

steps.expected: Call can be dialed out.
steps.instruction: Go to dialer, dial out a phone number that is in authorized number list added in step 9 from SIM 2(Long press dial key to select it if SIM 2 is not primary outgoing call SIM).

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.

objects.description:
As a user, when I tap on the voicemail notification, I want to use the correct subscription for that voicemail notification.


AC 1: I dont want to see a SIM picker when I tap the voicemail notification
AC 2: When I tap Voicemail notification (received via SIM1) then device should dial out via SIM 1 independant of what the default outgoing call SIM in settings is set to. (same for SIM2)
AC 3: I want to be presented the SIM picker when I long tap on 1 (in dialer) to dial voicemail and I want the right voicemail number to be picked from the SIM to dial.
AC 4: I want every voicemail noticiation to display via which SIM the notification was received
objects.name: [DSDS][VoiceMail] Tap on voicemail notification will bring me to correct SIM voicemail

steps.expected: Voicemail notification of SIM1
steps.instruction: Leave voicemail on SIM1

steps.expected: Voicemail notification of SIM2
steps.instruction: Leave voicemail on SIM2

steps.expected: the phone picks correct voicemail (SIM1) for me
steps.instruction: tap on voicemail notification of SIM1

steps.expected: the phone picks correct voicemail (SIM2) for me
steps.instruction: tap on voicemail notification of SIM2

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
Dial out calls from primary SIM cards should be restricted by corresponding FDN list.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify FDN Authorized number list with primary outgoing SIM

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Call settings, select SIM 1.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 and contacts can be added.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on and add a contact in Authorized nubmers.
Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 2.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 if it's on before disable it, otherwise keep it in off state.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to off.
Go to Settings > SIM manager, set SIM 1 as primary outgoing call SIM card.

steps.expected: FDN active message shows and call cannot be dialed out.
steps.instruction: Go to Dialer, short press dial key to dial a number that is not in FDN Authorized numbers from SIM 1.

steps.expected: Call can be dialed out.
steps.instruction: Short press dial key to dial a number that is in FDN Authorized numbers from SIM 1.
End the call and go to Settings > SIM manager, set SIM 2 as primary outgoing call SIM card.

steps.expected: Call can be dialed out.
steps.instruction: Go to Dialer, short press dial key to dial a phone number from SIM 2.

objects.description:
bug 946874

As a user, when I receive a phone call, I want to be informed on which SIM the call is received.

Acceptance Criteria

AC1: I want an easy to understand, on the receiving call screen, to show via which SIM the call is being received
AC2: If the device is locked and a call is received I want to see via which SIM the call is received


bug 947131

As a user, I want to see in the call log on which SIM card the call has been made or received

AC1: The information must be shown on the "ALL" tab and on the "MISSED" tab
AC2: I want to easily find this information without navigating a big menu tree  
AC3: If I have multiple calls from a single user then I want to see the last received via which SIM.
objects.name: [DSDS] I can simply understand which SIM is/was using when receiving calls

steps.expected: SIM info is displayed on the screen
steps.instruction: Receive an MT call when screen is locked
terminate the MT call and unlock screen

steps.expected: SIM info is displayed on the screen
steps.instruction: Receive an MT call when screen is unlocked
pick up the phone call and terminate it

steps.expected:
Call in step 1 will displayed in "Missed" with SIM info
Call in step 3 will displayed in "All" with SIM info
steps.instruction: check the call log

objects.description:
Enable or disable one SIM should not affect on another since each SIM has its own FDN setting.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT and both has FDN off.
objects.name: [DSDS] Enable or disable FDN of one SIM and check FDN state of another

steps.expected: Call setting of SIM 1 will be opened.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings App > Call settings, select SIM 1.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enable Fixed dialing numbers and enter correct PIN 2 code.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Disable".
steps.instruction: Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 2.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Disable".
steps.instruction: Select Fixed dialing numbers item.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Enable Fixed dialing numbers and enter correct PIN 2 code.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Disable".
steps.instruction: Disable SIM 2 FDN again and enter correct PIN 2 code.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 1.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Select Fixed dialing numbers item.

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
1 SIM for LTE network, 1 device with LTE support. 

As a user, I should be able to continue to use data connection even if the network type changed and corresponding APN also changed without my knowledge.
objects.name: [LTE] Test on APN changed on LTE device

steps.instruction: Launch "Settings", go to "Cellular & Data" (-> SIM selection) -> "Network operator" -> "Network type".

steps.expected: "LTE" selected and signal icon grayed out and came back again.
steps.instruction: Tap the drop down list of "Network type" and select "LTE" ( Not "LTE preferred")
Go to "Cellular & Data" (-> SIM selection) -> "Data settings".

steps.expected:
1. APN for LTE selected, signal icon on LTE with "4G" label on it.
2. "4G" icon shown on Notifications.
3. Icon in quick setting also changed to "4G".
4. Open "Settings", the label below "Cell & Data" also changed to "carrier - 4G"
steps.instruction: Turn on "Data connection" in "Cellular & Data".

steps.expected: Website opened.
steps.instruction: Open "Browser" and go to any website that has not been visited on this phone before(to eliminate the use of cache).

steps.expected: Signal icon on LTE without 4G label, and changed to 3G or H depending on the network type.
steps.instruction: Move the phone to where LTE is not available.

steps.expected: Website opened.
steps.instruction: Open "Browser" and go to any website that has not been visited on this phone before(to eliminate the use of cache).

objects.description:
When add or remove contacts on Authorized number list of one SIM should not affect on another.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Add or remove contacts from Authorized number list of one SIM and check the list of another

steps.expected: SIM 1 Call settings will be opened.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings App > Call settings, select SIM 1.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on and enter PIN 2.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 code again and contacts can be added.
steps.instruction: Open Authorized numbers item and add at least 3 contacts in it.
Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 2.

steps.expected: FDN shows "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on and enter PIN 2.

steps.expected: There is no contacts added in step 3.
steps.instruction: Open Authorized numbers.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 code again and contacts can be added.
steps.instruction: Add another 3 contacts.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 code again and contacts can be deleted.
steps.instruction: Go back to Call settings > SIM 1 > Authorized numbers, remove one of the contacts.

steps.expected: There are still 3 contacts.
steps.instruction: Go back to Call settings > SIM 2 > Authorized numbers.

objects.description:
As a user, I can change SIM PIN 2 when there is only one card in device.

Prerequisite:  Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
objects.name: [DSDS] Change PIN 2 code (One SIM inserted)

steps.instruction: Insert one SIM in SIM 1 slot, power on device.

steps.expected: Call settings of SIM 1 will be shown.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Call settings > select SIM 1.

steps.expected: SIM 1 PIN 2 code can be changed and related successful message will show. (When change PIN 1 successfully, there is confirming message popping up)
steps.instruction: Open Fixed dialing numbers, select "Reset PIN 2" to change the PIN 2 code.
Power off device. Remove current SIM and insert another SIM into SIM 2 slot, power device on.

steps.expected: Call settings of SIM 2 will be shown.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Call settings > select SIM 2.

steps.expected: SIM 2 PIN 2 code can be changed and related successful message will show. (When change PIN 1 successfully, there is confirming message popping up)
steps.instruction: Open Fixed dialing numbers, select "Reset PIN 2" to change the PIN 2 code.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, once I enter incorrect PIN 2 code while changing it, device will indicate correct remaining retry numbers.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Enter incorrect PIN 2 code while changing it

steps.expected: Call settings of SIM 1 will be shown.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Call settings > select SIM 1.

steps.expected: Page for user to enter current and new PIN 2 codes will be shown.
steps.instruction: Select Fixed dialing number item, then press "Reset PIN2".

steps.expected: It will show 2 tries left.
steps.instruction: Enter incorrect SIM PIN 2 and identical new code for "Create PIN" and "Confirm new PIN", then press Done.

steps.expected: Page for user to enter current and new PIN 2 codes will be shown., and no retry message on it.
steps.instruction: Back to Settings > Call settings, select SIM 2 and go to Fixed dialing number item and select "Reset PIN2".

steps.expected: Page will show last retry left.
steps.instruction: Enter incorrect SIM PIN 2  and identical new code for "Create PIN" and "Confirm new PIN" twice.

steps.expected: It will still show 2 tries left.
steps.instruction: Back to Settings > Call settings, select SIM 1 and go to Fixed dialing number item and select "Reset PIN2".

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:

objects.description:
If one of other participants in 3-way call hangs up the call, call connection of DUT and the third one remains.

Prerequisite: 1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network. 2. Please make sure CDMA test account has conference call and call waiting services activated.
objects.name: [CDMA][Conference call] Hang up 3-way call from other participant

steps.expected: Call can be answered.

steps.expected: First call will be put on hold and second call can be answered with phone B number information on dialer.
steps.instruction: While call is still connected, dial a call to phone B from DUT.

steps.expected: 3-way call will be established, but due to CDMA limitation, there will be no each phone number on dialer but only a description for conference call.

steps.expected: No information change on Dialer due to CDMA limitation but call connection between DUT and another phone(ex: if A hangs up, this will be B) remains without being disconnected.

objects.description:

steps.instruction: While call is still connected, dial a call to phone B from DUT.

objects.description:
Send SMS messages from primary SIM cards should be restricted by corresponding FDN list.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify FDN Authorized number list with primary outgoing SIM (SMS)

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Call settings, select SIM 2.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 and contacts can be added.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to on and add a contact and SMSC number of SIM 2(Please check SIM card carrier. Ex: TWN SIM in Taiwan SMSC is +886935874443) in Authorized nubmers.
Back to Settings, go to Call settings and select SIM 1.

steps.expected: It will request SIM PIN 2 if it's on before disable it, otherwise keep it in off state.
steps.instruction: Switch Fixed dialing numbers toggle to off.
Go to Settings > SIM manager, set SIM 2 as primary outgoing message SIM card.

steps.expected: FDN active message shows and message cannot be sent.
steps.instruction: Go to Message, compose a SMS and short press Send key to send it to a number that is not in FDN Authorized numbers from SIM 2.

steps.expected: SMS can be sent and received by target number.
steps.instruction: Compose a SMS and short press send key to send it to a number that is in FDN Authorized numbers from SIM 2.
Go to Settings > SIM manager, set SIM 1 as primary outgoing message card.

steps.expected: SMS can be sent and received by target number.
steps.instruction: Go to Message, compose a SMS and short press Send key to send it to a number that is not in SIM 2 FDN Authorized numbers from SIM 1.

objects.description:
As a user, I can unlock PUK lock of either SIM card.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 PIN enabled SIMcards into DUT.
objects.name: [DSDS] Unlock PUK code (in Security settings)

steps.expected: Both SIM PIN are enabled.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM Manager > Security settings.

steps.expected: PUK entry will show.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 1 and enter wrong PIN code for three times.

steps.expected: PUK can be unlocked.
steps.instruction: Enter correct SIM 1 PUK code and input new PIN code.

steps.expected: PUK entry will show.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 2 and enter wrong PIN code for three times.

steps.expected: PUK can be unlocked.
steps.instruction: Enter correct SIM 2 PUK code and input new PIN code.

objects.description:
As a user, I can interact with IVRS via both SIM cards.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with different PIN 2 code into DUT.

steps.expected: Call will be dialed out and connected.
steps.instruction: Go to Dialer, enter IVR system number of your test account and long press dial key to dial out from SIM 1(ex:188 for TWN carrier in Taiwan, or voicemail system of your test account).

steps.expected: IVR or voicemail system can recognize the key and being navigated correctly.
steps.instruction: Follow the voice instruction and dial the corresponding key on dialer.

steps.expected: Call will be dialed out and connected.
steps.instruction: End the call and go to Dialer, enter IVR system number of your test account and long press dial key to dial out from SIM 2(ex:188 for TWN carrier in Taiwan, or voicemail system of your test account).

steps.expected: IVR or voicemail system can recognize the key and being navigated correctly.
steps.instruction: Follow the voice instruction and dial the corresponding key on dialer.

objects.description:
As a user, when I long tap the button "Dial" in the Dialer, I want to be able to choose from which SIM the call is made.

Acceptance Criteria:

AC1: I only want this option to apply for that specific call 
AC2: I want to see the default SIM for making a call highlighted on this screen 
AC3: if I have "always ask" option chosen I want to be asked everytime i press the dial button.

Prerequisite: two SIM cards in the device
objects.name: As a user, I can choose always ask dialing with which SIM card by default

steps.instruction: Launch Settings > SIM Manager

steps.expected: Three options, "SIM 1", "SIM 2", and "Always ask"
steps.instruction: Tap on "Outgoing Calls"
Choose "Always ask" and back to home

steps.expected: An option panel for user to choose "SIM 1", or "SIM 2" to dial
steps.instruction: Launch dialer and make an MO call

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Having a variant.json configured to your mnc/mcc and it must have a line similar to:  "network\_type": "resources/mobizilla\_network\_type.json"

* Insert some code to make it more distinguishable
* Having a mobizilla\_network\_type.json configured similar to: 
{
"lte": "TEST 4G",
"ehrpd": "TEST 4G",
"umts": "TEST 3G",
"hspa+": "H+sp",
"evdo0": "Evsp",
"evdoa": "Evsp",
"evdob": "Evsp",
"gprs": "TEST 2Gsp",
"1xrtt": "TEST 1xsp",
"is95a": "TEST 1xsp",
"is95b": "TEST 1xsp",
"wcdma/gsm": "TEST 2G/TEST 3G GSM auto",
"gsm": "TEST 2G GSM",
"wcdma": "TEST 3G GSM",
"wcdma/gsm-auto": "TEST 2G GSM Preferred",
"cdma/evdo": "TEST 2G/TEST 3G CDMA auto",
"cdma": "TEST 2G CDMA",
"evdo": "TEST 3G CDMA",
"wcdma/gsm/cdma/evdo": "TEST 2G TEST 3G GSM/CDMA auto"
}
* Having a sim card configured with data connection 
* https://github.com/mozilla-b2g/gaia/blob/master/customization/mobizilla/mobizilla\_network\_type.json
objects.name: Verify that after a factory reset, "Network Type select" will be configured the same way as a brand new device (SIM NOT CONFIGURED)

steps.expected: ER1 The default options for the "Network type" are displayed. Each option not starts with the text "TEST"
steps.instruction:
1. Complete the FTE with a not configured sim card inserted 
2. Go to "Settings/Cellular & Data/Network Operator/Network Type" 
ER1

steps.expected:

steps.instruction: Drag the left caret back to second row

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to select text easily in editable text fields in order to perform actions on the selection (insert/delete/copy/cut, etc)
objects.name: [Keyboard][TextSelection] The utility bubble and carets will dismiss after tapping other area

steps.instruction: Launch the Contacts app or other app with "1 line input field"
Tap the "+" icon to edit a new contact
Input some characters on the "Email" field

steps.expected: One caret (water drop) shows up
steps.instruction: tap on any character of the email field

steps.expected: The characters are typed.
steps.instruction: type some characters (ex: 12345) after the caret

steps.expected:
1. The utility bubble and carets show up
2. The keyboard is also shown up
steps.instruction: Long press a specific character to activate text selection.

steps.expected: The keyboard & utility bubble are dismissed.
steps.instruction: Long press on white space key

steps.expected:
1. The utility bubble and carets show up
2. The keyboard is also shown up
steps.instruction: Long press a specific character to activate text selection.

steps.expected: The keyboard, utility bubble, and carets are dismissed
steps.instruction: Tapping on the other field

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description:
Verify that all strings are translated into the locale you are testing. 
If you find an untranslated string, look at the same string in a pseudolocale (preferably Accented English).
If the string appears in  normal English, it is hard-coded and not localizable.
File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y".
If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

objects.name: All strings on the screen are translated correctly without truncation when the user is on a call and then adds a contact

steps.instruction: Tap on the "Dialer" icon to open the dialer app.
Tap on the "dial pad" icon that is located at the bottom right corner of the screen.
Call another phone.

steps.expected: All strings are translated properly without truncation.
steps.instruction: While on call, tap 'add caller' button "phone w/ +" icon and check all the strings on the screen. If needed, tap on contacts icon (person)

objects.description:

Also refer to this document https://hg.mozilla.org/gaia-l10n/
objects.name: All strings on the "Call log" page are translated correctly without truncation. Call times and dates are also in the correct format.

steps.instruction: Tap on the "Dialer" icon to open the dialer app.
Tap on the "Call log" icon located at the bottom left corner of the screen.

steps.expected: All strings are translated properly without truncation.  Call times and dates are in the correct format according to the language set on the phone.
steps.instruction: Tap on the "All" tab and check all the strings on the "Call log" page.  Also check the format of the call times and dates. Check all days of the week and make sure they are translated correctly!

steps.expected: All strings are translated properly without truncation.  Call times and dates are in the correct format according to the language set on the phone.
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Missed" Tab and check all the strings on the "Call log" page.  Also check the format of the call times and dates. Check all days of the week to make sure they are translated correctly!

objects.description:
Verify that all strings are translated into the locale you are testing. If you find an untranslated string, look at the same string in a pseudolocale (preferably Accented English). If the string appears in normal English, it is hard-coded and not
localizable. File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y". If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.
objects.name: All strings on the 'Device information' screen are translated correctly without truncation.

steps.expected: There is no truncation. Nothing overlaps. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Tap on 'Settings' from the home screen and tap 'Device information'

objects.description:

localizable. File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y". If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard
